framework.framework_title: A comparison and contrast essay 3 (Describing the features of X and Y, then comparing)

framework_intro.para: Below is a suggested framework to help you structure this type of essay. This framework describes the features of X, followed by the features of Y, then compares the two. There are spaces for you to add your notes and the content of your essay.

checklist.point: Brainstorm ideas about similarities and differences. For example, arrange points in a table.
Highlight the similarities and the differences and decide which are more important.
Choose which points to include in your essay and which to leave out.
Decide how to define the two things you are comparing.
Organize your notes into the framework.
Use words and phrases to describe differences.
Use words and phrases to describe similarities.
Use connecting words and phrases to make the structure of your essay clear to your readers.
Have I introduced the subject, developed it logically and come to a conclusion?
Does the conclusion follow logically from the rest of the essay?
Have I checked vocabulary, grammar, spelling and punctuation?

paragraph.name: Introduction
paragraph.desc: Introduce the topic. Explain the scope of the essay.

paragraph.name: Characteristics of X
paragraph.desc: Describe and discuss the important features of one of the two things you are comparing.
paragraph.tip: TIP You can use several paragraphs here.

paragraph.name: Characteristics of Y
paragraph.desc: Describe and discuss the important features of the second of the two things you are comparing.
paragraph.tip: TIP You can use several paragraphs here.

paragraph.name: Comparison of X and Y
paragraph.desc: Show how Y is similar to or different from X.
paragraph.tip: TIP You can use several paragraphs here.

paragraph.name: Conclusion
paragraph.desc: Summarize and give a personal opinion or conclusion based on the strength of the similarities and differences discussed.
